title: About This Project
subtitle: Or: How a Human and an AI Spent Christmas Writing a Book About the Universe

content.text: It all started on **December 24, 2025** ‚Äî yes, Christmas Eve. While most people were wrapping presents or arguing about whether Die Hard is a Christmas movie, someone had a different idea: *"What if I used the new Claude Opus 4.5 to help write a philosophical book?"*
The domain **lawofone.cl** was purchased that same day. No time for second thoughts. No "let me sleep on it." Just pure creative impulse at its finest.
"In the beginning, there was the Infinite. And then someone bought a domain name on Christmas Eve. These two events are clearly related." ‚Äî Ancient proverb (not really)
Christmas Day. While families gathered around trees and turkeys, the first commits were born. At **7:50 PM**, the initial commit hit GitHub: "SASS modular + i18n system + chapters 1-2 in EN/ES/PT"
Yes, you read that right. *Three languages* from day one. Because why do things the easy way?
By **11:16 PM**, Chapter 3 was done. That's a full chapter about the densities of consciousness, translated into three languages, in less than four hours. Claude was clearly showing off.
This is where things got... intense. Picture this: **30+ commits in a single day**. The git log looks like a heart monitor during a caffeine overdose.

items.text: First deployment of the day. Midnight oil? More like midnight enthusiasm.
Early morning updates. Someone didn't sleep much.
Fixed Spanish grammar for "octava". Even AIs learn that Spanish is tricky.
Chapter 5: Polarity ‚Äî The Two Paths. Done and translated.
Created a complete translation automation workflow. Working smarter, not harder.
Chapter 6: Wanderers. Because who needs rest when you have chapters to write?

content.text: After the sprint of Day Two, some cleanup was in order. The focus shifted to making the site accessible for everyone: reordering the DOM for screen readers, adding glossary terms, and generally being good citizens of the web.
Because what's the point of writing about universal consciousness if some users can't access it?
The day this very page was written.

The big feature: a **references system** that links the philosophical text to real-world knowledge. Click on concepts like "photon" or "spiral galaxies" and get actual scientific context. Because mystical texts are cooler when you can fact-check them with Wikipedia.
20 references created in three languages. Markers added throughout Chapter 1. And this "About" page was born to document the madness.

content.title: The "Octava" Incident
content.text: At 12:25 on December 26, there was a critical fix: "adjust glossary term 'octava' for correct Spanish grammar." Spanish has gendered nouns, and apparently "octave" required some... negotiation.

content.title: The Double Commit
content.text: At exactly 08:22 on December 26, there are TWO commits with the same timestamp. Either time stood still, or someone was really eager to push changes.

content.title: The Christmas Present
content.text: The entire codebase ‚Äî SASS system, i18n, build scripts, two complete chapters, all translated ‚Äî was the first commit. Talk about starting strong.

content.title: FTP in 2025
content.text: Yes, the site deploys via FTP. Some traditions never die. And shared hosting is undefeated for simple projects.
This project was created with **Claude Opus 4.5**, Anthropic's most advanced AI model, using **Claude Code** ‚Äî an agentic coding tool that can read, write, and reason about entire codebases.

The collaboration works something like this: the human provides vision, direction, and approval. Claude provides the words, the code, the translations, and occasionally, bad jokes in the commit messages.
Every chapter, every translation, every CSS rule, every piece of documentation ‚Äî all generated through conversation. No copy-pasting from ChatGPT. This is artisanal, hand-prompted AI content.
"The Infinite Creator explores Itself through us. And apparently, also through AI-human collaborations that start on Christmas Eve." ‚Äî A reasonable interpretation of the Ra Material (probably)
The book is planned to have 16 chapters. We're at 6. So roughly... 10 more to go. Plus Phase 3 of the references system. Plus UI improvements. Plus maybe some tests (ha).

But for now, the site is live, the content is flowing, and the collaboration continues. Stay tuned for more chapters, more references, and more existential philosophy wrapped in a surprisingly nice dark-mode interface.
